alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 10:57PM CDT until April 13 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR BUTLER...MONROE...SOUTHEASTERN CLARKE...SOUTHEASTERN WILCOX AND CONECUH COUNTIES... At 1056 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles east of Dannelly Reservoir to 5 miles southwest of Beatrice to 14 miles east of McIntosh, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Monroeville, Evergreen, Frisco City, Peterman, Georgiana, Uriah, Excel, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Repton, Pine Apple and I65 And US 84. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
